requirements.requirement_text: "A conformant Plan-Net service SHALL NOT require a directory mobile application to send consumer identifying information in order to query content."
"A directory mobile application SHALL NOT send consumer identifiable information when querying a Plan-Net service."
"Health Plan API actors SHALL be capable of populating all Must Support data elements as part of the query results."
requirements.source: Must Support Section -> Health Plan API Requirements

requirements.requirement_text: "In situations where information on a particular Must Support data element is not present and the minimum cardinality is 0 , the Health Plan API actors SHALL NOT include the data elements in the resource instance returned as part of the query results."
requirements.conditional: True (when information on a Must Support data element is not present and the minimum cardinality is 0)
requirements.source: Must Support Section -> Health Plan API Requirements

requirements.requirement_text: "In situations where information on a particular data element is not present and the minimum cardinality is >0 SHALL send the reason for the missing information using values (such as nullFlavors) from the value set where they exist or use the dataAbsentReason extension."
requirements.conditional: True (when information on a particular data element is not present and the minimum cardinality is >0)
requirements.source: Must Support Section -> Health Plan API Requirements

requirements.requirement_text: "Application actors SHALL be capable of processing resource instances containing the Must Support data elements without generating an error or causing the application to fail."
"Application actors SHOULD be capable of displaying the data elements for human use or storing the information for other purposes."
"When querying Health Plan API actors, Application actors SHALL interpret missing Must Support data elements within resource instances as data not present in the Health Plan API actors system."
requirements.conditional: True (when querying Health Plan API actors)

requirements.requirement_text: "Consumer App actors SHALL be able to process resource instances containing Must Support data elements asserting missing information."
"To search for Practitioners or Organizations that will be active at a future time, change the date to a future date."
"If no period is provided, then it is assumed the role is active with no expiration date."
"It is essential that each provider's service be supported by appropriate set of HealthcareService instances."

"HealthcareServices are typically provided by an organization, except in the case of a Practitioner that is not associated with an organization (see the solo practitioner example), and can be linked to a set of locations where service is provided, or identified as virtual services through an indicated set of virtual modalities."
requirements.conditional: True (if the practitioner is not associated with an organization)

requirements.requirement_text: "All organizations that provide service should define an appropriate set of HealthcareServices to facilitate search."
"Practitioners and Organizations indicate participation in a Network with a link to the Network using a PractitionerRole or OrganizationAffiliation instance, respectively."
"PractitionerRole and OrganizationAffiliation instances are what tie Practitioners and Organizations to HealthcareServices, Organizations, Networks and Locations."
"The examples demonstrate the use of the InsurancePlan profile to represent two distinct Qualified Health Plan products covering the state of Connecticut, using a pair of Networks."
"The practitioners and organizations in the examples participate in one or both of these networks."
requirements.conditional: True (if they are part of the examples)

requirements.requirement_text: "The Location resource SHALL comply with the StructureDefinition-plannet-Location.html specification."
requirements.source: Location-CancerClinicLoc.html, Location-HansSoloClinic.html, Location-HospLoc1.html, Location-HospLoc2.html, Location-PharmLoc1.html, Location-PharmLoc2.html, Location-PharmLoc3.html, Location-PharmLoc4.html, Location-StateOfCTLocation.html

requirements.requirement_text: "The Organization resource SHALL comply with the StructureDefinition-plannet-Network.html specification."

"The resource may be used to encompass a variety of services covering the entire healthcare spectrum, including promotion, prevention, diagnostics, hospital and ambulatory care, home care, long-term care, and other health-related and community services."
"An InsurancePlan is a discrete package of health insurance coverage benefits that are offered under a particular network type."
"A plan pairs a product’s covered benefits with the particular cost sharing structure offered to a consumer."
"A Location is the physical place where healthcare services are provided, practitioners are employed, organizations are based, etc."
requirements.this_analysis_provides_a_clear_requireme: the organization/practitioner, the payer, and the healthcare provider. Each requirement is written as a direct quote from the FHIR Implementation Guide, and it maintains the original context of the requirement. The conformance level for each requirement is also clearly stated.

requirements.requirement_text: "Change Organization.type binding from OrganizationType to NetworkType"
"Added 'catastrophic' options to Insurance Plan Types"
"Ability to manage Provider Directory List for incoming/outgoing providers"
"Update Resource Relationships Diagram"
"Fix Spelling"
"Transitioned IG to Sushi 1.0.0 directory structure"
requirements.source: IG © 2022+ [HL7 Financial Management Working Group](http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees/fm). Package hl7.fhir.us.davinci-pdex-plan-net#1.1.0 based on [FHIR 4.0.1](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/). Generated 2022-04-04

requirements.requirement_text: "The Implementation Guide must include [Behavior: Capability Statements]"
"The Implementation Guide must include [Behavior: Search Parameters]"
"The Implementation Guide must include [Structures: Resource Profiles]"
"The Implementation Guide must include [Structures: Extension Definitions]"
"The Implementation Guide must include [Terminology: Value Sets]"
"The Implementation Guide must include [Terminology: Code Systems]"
"The Implementation Guide must include [Example: Example Instances]"
"This Section describes the expected capabilities of the Plan-Net Server actor which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the Plan-Net Requestors."
"The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by Plan-Net Servers are defined."
"Systems implementing this capability statement should meet the CMS FInal Rule requirement for provider directory access."
requirements.actor: All Systems implementing the capability statement

requirements.requirement_text: "Plan-Net Clients can use the required capabilities to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements."
"These define the properties by which a RESTful server can be searched."
"They can also be used for sorting and including related resources."
"Select HealthcareServices with the specified name"
"Select HealthcareServices providing the specified category of services"
"Select HealthcareServices of the specified type"
"Select services associated with the specified specialty"
"Select products that are administered by the specified organization"
"Select products that are offered in the specified location"
"Select products with the specified identifier"
"Select products with the specified name"
"Select products that are owned by the specified organization"
"Select insurance plans of the specified type"
"Select Locations with the specified address.city"
"Select Locations with the specified address"
"Select Locations with the specified address.state"
"Select Locations with the specified endpoint"
"Select Locations managed by the specified organization"
"Select Locations that are part of the specified location"
"Select Locations of the specified type"
"Select organizations with the specified address (matches any of the string elements of an address)"
"Select roles offered by the specified organization"
"Select OrganizationAffiliations with the specified role"
"Select OrganizationAffiliations providing the specified service"
"Select OrganizationAffiliations associated with the specified specialty"
"Select Practitioners with the specified family name"
"Select Practitioners with the specified given name"
"Select Practitioners with the specified name (matches against any of the elements in the HumanName data type)"
"Select PractitionerRoles with the specified endpoint"
"Select roles where the practitioner is a member of the specified health insurance provider network"
"Select PractitionerRoles available at the specified organization"
"Select PractitionerRoles available in the specified period"
"Select roles filled by the specified practitioner"
"Select PractitionerRoles with the specified role"
"Select PractitionerRoles providing the specified service"
"Select PractitionerRoles associated with the specified specialty"
"These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide"
"The technical details of an endpoint that can be used for electronic services, such as a portal or FHIR REST services, messaging or operations, or DIRECT messaging."

"The resource may be used to encompass a variety of services covering the entire healthcare spectrum, including promotion, prevention, diagnostics, pharmacy, hospital and ambulatory care, home care, long-term care, and other health-related and community services."
"An InsurancePlan is a discrete package of health insurance coverage benefits that are offered under a particular network type."
"A plan pairs a product’s covered benefits with the particular cost sharing structure offered to a consumer."

"InsurancePlan describes a health insurance offering comprised of a list of covered benefits (i.e. the product), costs associated with those benefits (i.e. the plan), and additional information about the offering, such as who it is owned and administered by, a coverage area, contact information, etc."
"A Location is the physical place where healthcare services are provided, practitioners are employed, organizations are based, etc."
"Locations can range in scope from a room in a building to a geographic region/area."
"A reference to the healthcare provider insurance networks (plannet-Network) the practitioner participates in through their role"
"New Patients indicates whether new patients are being accepted in general, or from a specific network. This extension is included in the PractitionerRole, HealthcareService, and Location profiles."
"An extension to provide a human-readable description of an organization."
"An extension to add status and whereValid elements to a practitioner’s qualifications."
"An extension to add qualifications for an organization (e.g. accreditation) or practitionerRole (e.g. registered to prescribe controlled substances)."
"A reference to an alternative point of contact (plannet-PractitionerRole, plannet-Organization, plannet-OrganizationAffiliation, or plannet-Location) for this organization"
"Language Proficiency VS" must provide codes for documenting spoken language proficiency based on the Interagency Language Roundtable scale.
"Minimum Endpoint Connection Types VS" shall define the minimum endpoint connection types.
"Network Type VS" should provide a single value describing networks.
"Non-Individual Specialties" must provide Non-Individual Specialties from National Uniform Claim Committee (NUCC) Health Care Provider Taxonomy code set.
"Organization Type VS" must provide categories of organizations based on criteria in provider directories.
"Specialties and Degree License and Certificates"
"Codes for virtual service delivery modalities."
"Codes to identify if the practice is accepting new patients."
"General categories of accommodations available."
"Categories of healthcare service delivery methods."
"Extension codes for http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/endpoint-connection-type."
"Endpoint Payload Types are constrained to NA (Not Applicable) as part of this IG."
"Broad categories of healthcare services being performed or delivered."
"Categories of cost-sharing used by plans."
"A distinct package of health insurance coverage benefits that are offered using a particular product network type."
Hans Solo is represented as a solo practitioner in [HansSoloRole1](PractitionerRole-HansSoloRole1.html "PractitionerRole/HansSoloRole1").

Hartford Orthopedic Services' affiliation with Acme of CT Provider Network and Hartford General Hospital should be correctly represented in [HartfordOrthopedicAffil](OrganizationAffiliation-HartfordOrthopedicAffil.html "OrganizationAffiliation/HartfordOrthopedicAffil").

Dr Joe Smith's roles should be correctly represented in [JoeSmithRole1](PractitionerRole-JoeSmithRole1.html "PractitionerRole/JoeSmithRole1"), [JoeSmithRole2](PractitionerRole-JoeSmithRole2.html "PractitionerRole/JoeSmithRole2") and [JoeSmithRole3](PractitionerRole-JoeSmithRole3.html "PractitionerRole/JoeSmithRole3").
"eliminate extensions that are not necessary for this use case"
requirements.conditional: True, depends on the use case

requirements.requirement_text: "introduce additional constraints (e.g. search criteria, cardinality, value-set bindings and MustSupport) where appropriate."
requirements.conditional: True, depends on the use case

requirements.requirement_text: "The IG defines the API that exposes a payer’s provider network (including pharmacy locations where appropriate) for access by a consumer or provider application."
requirements.actor: FHIR Implementation Guide Developer, Consumer or Provider Application

requirements.requirement_text: "This is a query only API (GET) and does not support PUT or POST."
requirements.actor: FHIR Implementation Guide Developer, Consumer or Provider Application

requirements.requirement_text: "The PractitionerRole profile from US Core was not used because it is over-constrained for use in a Provider Directory based on Payer information."
requirements.source: Relation to US Core and other IGs section

requirements.requirement_text: "The Network profile is based on USCore Organization, since there was no contradiction between the USCore profile and the Plan-Net requirements."
requirements.source: Relation to US Core and other IGs section

requirements.requirement_text: "NPI and CLIA identifier types, which are Must-Support, are clearly intended for provider organizations only and are not expected to be populated for other organization types."
requirements.source: Relation to US Core and other IGs section

requirements.requirement_text: "Alignment with VhDir is maintained by adapting VhDir content, where possible."
requirements.source: Relation to US Core and other IGs section

requirements.requirement_text: "The PDEX Payer Network implementation guide is based conceptually on the VhDir implementation guide, which is still a work in progress. Plan-net will need to track changes to VhDir to fulfill its goal of minimizing rework."
"Provider directories play a critical role in enabling identification of individual providers and provider organizations, as well as characteristics about them."
"Provider directories support a variety of use cases, including: Patient/Payer focused"
"Find provider accessibility information (specialty, office hours, languages spoken, taking patients)"
"Relationship between provider and insurance plan (insurance accepted) or plan and provider (network)"
"Enable electronic exchange (e.g. discovery of electronic endpoints such as IHE/EHR endpoints, FHIR server URLs, Direct addresses)"
"Find an individual and/or organization (even if no electronic endpoint is available)"
"Health Plan API Actor: A payer publishing a directory of its provider networks through a FHIR endpoint."
requirements.source: This IG addresses two actors section

requirements.requirement_text: "Support forward and reverse chaining on all search parameters that specify the 'chain' property."
"Support xml source formats for all Plan-Net interactions."
"A server SHALL reject any unauthorized requests by returning an `HTTP 401` unauthorized response code."
requirements.conditional: True (conditional on the request being unauthorized)

requirements.requirement_text: "Each Resource Type SHALL support its listed Supported Profiles, Supported Searches, Supported `_includes`, Supported `_revincludes`, and Supported Operations."
requirements.source: RESTful Capabilities by Resource/Profile: Summary of Search Criteria

requirements.requirement_text: "A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a Endpoint resource using: GET [base]/Endpoint/[id]/_history/vid"
requirements.source: FHIR Implementation Guide Content - Endpoint Resource

requirements.requirement_text: "A Server SHALL be capable of supporting the following _includes: Endpoint:organization - GET [base]/Endpoint?[parameter=value]&_include=Endpoint:organization"
requirements.source: FHIR Implementation Guide Content - Endpoint Resource

requirements.requirement_text: "A Server SHALL be capable of returning a HealthcareService resource using: GET [base]/HealthcareService/[id]"
requirements.source: FHIR Implementation Guide Content - HealthcareService Resource

requirements.requirement_text: "A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a HealthcareService resource using: GET [base]/HealthcareService/[id]/_history/vid"
requirements.source: FHIR Implementation Guide Content - HealthcareService Resource

requirements.requirement_text: "A Server SHALL be capable of supporting the following _includes: HealthcareService:location - GET [base]/HealthcareService?[parameter=value]&_include=HealthcareService:location"
requirements.source: FHIR Implementation Guide Content - HealthcareService Resource

requirements.requirement_text: "A Server SHOULD be capable of returning a InsurancePlan resource using: GET [base]/InsurancePlan/[id]/_history/vid"
"A Server SHALL be capable of supporting the following _includes: InsurancePlan:administered-by - GET [base]/InsurancePlan?[parameter=value]&_include=InsurancePlan:administered-by"
"A Server SHALL be capable of supporting the following _includes: InsurancePlan:owned-by - GET [base]/InsurancePlan?[parameter=value]&_include=InsurancePlan:owned-by"
"A Server SHALL be capable of supporting the following _includes: InsurancePlan:coverage-area - GET [base]/InsurancePlan?[parameter=value]&_include=InsurancePlan:coverage-area"
"Conformance Expectation: SHALL Supported Profiles: [Plan-Net Location](StructureDefinition-plannet-Location.html) Reference Policy: `resolves`"
"`GET [base]/Organization?[parameter=value]&_revinclude=InsurancePlan:owned-by`"
"`GET [base]/Organization?[parameter=value]&_revinclude=OrganizationAffiliation:primary-organization`"
"`GET [base]/Organization?[parameter=value]&_revinclude=PractitionerRole:organization`"
"`GET [base]/Organization?[parameter=value]&_revinclude=PractitionerRole:network`"
"`GET [base]/Organization?[parameter=value]&_revinclude=OrganizationAffiliation:participating-organization`"
"OrganizationAffiliation **SHALL** support `search-type`, `read`."
"OrganizationAffiliation **SHOULD** support `vread`."
"SHALL [service] reference `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?service=[service]`"
"SHALL [network] reference `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?network=[network]`"
"SHALL [endpoint] reference `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?endpoint=[endpoint]`"
"SHALL [role] token `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?role=[system] [code]`"
"SHALL [specialty] token `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?specialty=[system] [code]`"
"SHALL [_id] token `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?_id=[id]`"
"SHALL [_lastUpdated] date `GET [base]/PractitionerRole?_lastUpdated=[_lastUpdated]`"
